article.title: Electroweak and Higgs Boson Internal Bremsstrahlung: General considerations for Majorana dark matter annihilation and application to MSSM neutralinos

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about the Feynman diagrams shown in Figure 1 is FALSE?
choices: Dotted lines represent scalar or vector mediators.
Fermion final states are always identical (F = f).
The top row of diagrams represents s-channel processes.
The bottom row of diagrams represents t/u-channel processes.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the common feature of the amplitudes represented in Figure 2?
choices: They are all mediated by t-channel sfermions.
They are all mediated by s-channel bosons with a mass at the electroweak scale.
They all involve the emission of a photon.
They are all mediated by s-channel bosons with a mass at the scale of the CP-odd Higgs A.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 shows the same type of annihilation process as Figure 2, but with a key difference. What is the difference?
choices: The final state bosons are different.
The mass scale of the s-channel mediating bosons is different.
The initial state particles are different.
The chirality of the final state fermions is different.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 5 demonstrate about the relationship between 2-body and 3-body annihilation processes for pure Higgsinos?
choices: The 3-body cross section is always smaller than the 2-body result.
The 3-body cross section can be significantly larger than the lowest-order result below the kinematic threshold for the 2-body process.
The model-independent estimate of the 3-body cross section does not provide a good approximation to the full result.
Above the threshold, the 3-body and 2-body cross sections are significantly different.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Table 1, which combination of final state boson (B) and fermion chirality can lift BOTH Yukawa and isospin suppression?
choices: ZL/A with F¯RfL or F¯LfR
h with F¯LfL
WT with F¯RfR
ZT/γ with F¯LfL

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about Table 2 is TRUE?
choices: For a Wino-like neutralino, the maximal enhancement in t+u-channel processes can occur for final states with h/H bosons.
For a Bino-like neutralino, s-channel processes with ZL/A bosons can realize the maximal enhancement allowed by chiral and isospin symmetry.
For a Higgsino-like neutralino, t+u-channel processes with WT bosons can realize the maximal enhancement allowed by chiral and isospin symmetry.
For a Bino-like neutralino, the maximal enhancement in t+u-channel processes can occur for final states with ZT bosons.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of suppression lifting is illustrated in the second column of Table 3?
choices: Isospin suppression only
Yukawa suppression only
Neither Yukawa nor isospin suppression
Both Yukawa and isospin suppression

multiple_choice_question.text: Which benchmark model features the largest enhancement in the antiproton yield (integrated above Ex > mχ/10)?
choices: D1
D3
T1
W
